thread.title: Kashyap retires in Round 2 of French Open
thread.title_full: Kashyap retires in Round 2 of French Open

author: tribuneindia.com
title: Kashyap retires in Round 2 of French Open
text:
Paris, October 22
Parupalli Kashyap bowed out of the French Open after he retired hurt in the third game of his second round match against Rajiv Ouseph of England in the $275,000 Super Series tournament. Eighth seed Kashyap lost the opening game but came back strongly to win the second game 21-13. The World No.10 was trailing 2-4 in the deciding game when he opted against continuing the competition due to fitness issues. HS Pronnoy went down to Hong Kong's NG Ka Long Angus 21-15, 21-10 in 31 minutes.
Saina concedes world No. 1 spot to Marin Early exits at Japan Open and Denmark Open proved costly for ace India shuttler Saina Nehwal as she lost her World No.1 crown to All England and World champion Carolina Marin of Spain. In the latest ranking list, Saina dropped to No.2 spot with 81782 points, 1630 points behind Marin. â€” PTI
